page.title: 10SOCIAL CENTRE AT LEIGHTON
page.content: In 1968 Bedfordshire County Council opened its first purpose built Social Centre for the handicapped. It is at Duncombe Drive in Leighton Buzzard, adjacent to Westlands residential home for the elderly. Many economies are effected by combining the heating and cooking. In 1970 it became a Day Centre for elderly people although young handicapped people still attend. During the week an average of one hundred people attend the Centre each day and have midday meals. Many activities take place, such as the Darby and Joan Club, Blind Social Club, Bingo, Keep Fit classes and Yoga. There are also billiards, board and card games, a television room and a library. A hairdresser attends three days a week and a chiropodist at regular intervals.
